meanings.sent1: The diligent bibliographers worked hard to create a comprehensive list of all the books in the library.
meanings.sent2: Librarians often consult bibliographers to help organize the collection of books.
meanings.sent3: The bibliographers had a race to see who could compile the longest bibliography in the shortest time.
meanings.sent4: She was a bibliographer extraordinaire, able to compile bibliographies with lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the sound of pages turning as the bibliographers meticulously worked on their bibliographies.

meanings.definition: The study of books and their history.
meanings.sent1: Studying to become a bibliographer involves learning about the history of books and their authors.
meanings.sent2: Bibliographers play a crucial role in preserving the knowledge and history contained in books.
meanings.sent3: The bibliographers' conference was filled with discussions about ancient manuscripts and rare book collections.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bibliographers, every book tells a story beyond its pages.
meanings.sent5: The passion for bibliographers is fueled by the endless discoveries hidden within the pages of old books.
